::DevilDuer::

DevilDuer's eyes follow Diamond's as she looks down at her wrists, 
the Alliance bot noticing the cuffs. He looks back up as she covers 
them by folding her arms, his gaze locking on the machine's screen as 
he thinks over her words. He'd have to watch her.

"Hmm," he says, glancing at her, not acting any different than he was 
before he noticed the cuffs, or at least not showing outside, "I 
found it better to make a small chip and plug it into their head. 
Easier that way, all the neural connections are closer. Mine warped 
the bot's mind untill they wanted to do as I say, but most of the 
bots on this planet are far too advanced for the old design."


--- In nbwrpg@egroups.com, logomorph@h... wrote:
> ::Diamond::
> 
> She looked at her wrists.  She still had her old cuffs on.
> She walked over to the wall and leaned against it. She folded her 
> arms to cover her wrists. "Well, the cuffs would not only control 
the 
> bot, but relay all actions that the bot did to the council. It 
> constantly monitored the bot's movements as well as it's thoughts.  
> The one who had the main controlling computer could control the the 
> bot totally. The bot's mind, actions,feelings, everything." She 
> looked down and sighed.  "Those things aren't what I would call a 
> good thing. They can do strange things to a bots mind if left to 
> control the bot to long."
